sen.j: 福岡 孝悌（ふくおか たかちか、天保6年2月5日 (旧暦)（1835年3月3日） - 大正8年（1919年）3月7日）は、幕末期の土佐藩の家老、明治時代の政治家。
sen.e: Takachika Fukuoka (March 3, 1835 - March 7, 1919) was a Karo (chief retainer) of the Tosa clan at the end of the Tokugawa period and a statesman in the Meiji period.
Takachika Fukuoka (March 3, 1835 - March 7, 1919) was a Karo (chief retainer) of the Tosa Domain in the end of the Tokugawa period and a statesman in the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 文法ミスを修正しました用語登録の訳に修正しました
sen.e: Takachika Fukuoka (March 3, 1835 - March 7, 1919) was a Karo (chief retainer) of the Tosa Domain in the end of the Tokugawa period and a statesman in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 通称を藤次、雅号は南蘋。
sen.e: His common name was Toji and his gago was Nanbin.
His common name was Toji and his Gago (pseudonym) was Nanbin.
sen.cmt: 単語の訳を補足しました
sen.e: His common name was Toji and his Gago (pseudonym) was Nanbin.

sen.j: 子爵。
sen.e: He was awarded the title of Viscount.
He was awarded the title of Viscount.
He was awarded the title of Viscount.

tit.cmt: 統一リストに従いました。

sen.j: 1835年、土佐藩士・福岡孝順の二男として生まれる。
sen.e: In 1835 Fukuoka was born as a second son of Kyojun FUKUOKA, retainer of the Tosa clan.
In 1835, Fukuoka was born as a second son of Kyojun FUKUOKA, a feudal retainer of the Tosa Domain.
sen.cmt: カンマを追加しました用語登録の訳に修正しました
sen.e: In 1835, Fukuoka was born as a second son of Kyojun FUKUOKA, a feudal retainer of the Tosa Domain.

sen.j: 1854年、吉田東洋の門下生として後藤象二郎や板垣退助らと共に師事し、その薫陶をうけた。
sen.e: In 1854 he became a disciple of Toyo YOSHIDA and studied with Shojiro GOTO, Taisuke ITAGAKI and others.
In 1854, he studied under Toyo YOSHIDA as his disciple with Shojiro GOTO, Taisuke ITAGAKI and others.
sen.cmt: カンマを追加しました表現を修正しました
sen.e: In 1854, he studied under Toyo YOSHIDA as his disciple with Shojiro GOTO, Taisuke ITAGAKI and others.

sen.j: 1858年、吉田の藩政復帰に伴なって大監察に登用され、後藤らと若手革新グループ「新おこぜ組」を結成して藩政改革に取り組む。
sen.e: In 1858 he was appointed as Daikansatsu (senior inspector) upon Yoshida's return to the politics of the Tosa clan and formed a group of young reformists named "Shin Okozegumi" to reform the politics of the clan.

In 1858, he was appointed as Daikansatsu (senior inspector) with Yoshida's return to the politics of the Tosa Domain and formed a group of young reformists named 'Shin Okozegumi' to reform the politics of the domain.
sen.cmt: カンマを追加しました記号を修正しました文法ミスを修正しました単語の訳を修正しました
sen.e: In 1858, he was appointed as Daikansatsu (senior inspector) with Yoshida's return to the politics of the Tosa Domain and formed a group of young reformists named 'Shin Okozegumi' to reform the politics of the domain.

sen.j: 反主流派の土佐勤皇党を弾圧するなどしたが、1862年の吉田暗殺によって失脚する。
sen.e: He oppressed the Tosaginno Party (Tosa Loyalist Party), which was an anti-mainstream faction, but the assignation of Yoshida brought about Fukuoka's downfall.
He oppressed the Tosaginno Party (Tosa Loyalist Party), which was an anti-mainstream faction, but the assignation of Yoshida brought about Fukuoka's downfall in 1862.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れに対応しました。
sen.e: He oppressed the Tosaginno Party (Tosa Loyalist Party), which was an anti-mainstream faction, but the assignation of Yoshida brought about Fukuoka's downfall in 1862.

sen.j: 1863年、藩主山内豊範の側役に就任して公武合体運動に尽力する。
sen.e: In 1863 he assumed the post of Sobayaku (personal attendant) to the lord of the clan, Toyonori YAMAUCHI, and made efforts for the movement of Kobu Gattai (union of imperial court and shogunate).
In 1863, he assumed the post of Sobayaku (Secretary) to the lord of the clan, Toyonori YAMAUCHI, and made efforts for the movement of Kobu Gattai (union of the imperial court and the shogunate).
sen.cmt: 用語登録の訳に修正しました文法ミスを修正しました
sen.e: In 1863, he assumed the post of Sobayaku (Secretary) to the lord of the clan, Toyonori YAMAUCHI, and made efforts for the movement of Kobu Gattai (union of the imperial court and the shogunate).

sen.j: 他方で坂本龍馬や海援隊、陸援隊と提携するなど、元藩主山内豊信を中心に藩営商社・開成館を通じて殖産興業政策を推進した。
sen.e: On the other hand, he actively promoted the measures for the encouragement of new industry led by the former lord Toyonobu YAMAUCHI, through a clan-owned trading enterprise Kaiseikan as well as in alliance with Ryoma SAKAMOTO, the Kaientai (Japan's first modern corporation established by Ryoma SAKAMOTO) and the Rikuentai (military group organized by Shintaro NAKAOKA).
sen.cmt: 開成館→富国強兵を目指して設立されたｌ機関で貿易はその一部であり、必ずしも開成館＝商社ではありません。（参考）http://www.city.kochi.kochi.jp/deeps/01/0104/rekishi/re0912.htm陸援隊→Rikuentai (a military group organized by Shintaro NAKAOKA)（参考） Japan Encyclopedia (L. Frederic著）
sen.e: On the other hand, in alliance with Ryoma SAKAMOTO, the Kaientai (Japan's first modern corporation established by Ryoma SAKAMOTO) and the Rikuentai (military group organized by Shintaro NAKAOKA, he actively promoted the measures for the encouragement of new industry led by the former lord Toyonobu YAMAUCHI, through a clan-owned trading enterprise Kaiseikan.

sen.e: On the other hand, in alliance with Ryoma SAKAMOTO, the Kaientai (Japan's first modern corporation established by Ryoma SAKAMOTO) and the Rikuentai (military group organized by Shintaro NAKAOKA, he actively promoted the measures for the encouragement of new industry led by the former lord Toyonobu YAMAUCHI, through a clan-owned trading enterprise Kaiseikan.

sen.j: 1867年、参政に就任。
sen.e: In 1867 FUKUOKA assumed the post of Sansei (councilor).

sen.j: 江戸幕府を中心とする公議政体論を藩論とし、大政奉還の実現に向けて薩摩藩との間に薩土盟約を締結する。
sen.e: He advocated the Kogi Seitairon (political theory focused on the parliamentary system) with the Edo bakufu being a central faction as Tosa clan's public opinion and made Satsudo Meiyaku (the alliance between Satsuma and Tosa) in order to realize Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor).

He advocated the Kogi Seitairon (political theory focused on the parliamentary system), of which the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was a central faction, as Tosa clan's public opinion and made Satsudo Meiyaku (the alliance between Satsuma and Tosa) in order to realize Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor).
sen.cmt: 訳に補足をしました分の構成を修正しました
sen.e: He advocated the Kogi Seitairon (political theory focused on the parliamentary system), of which the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was a central faction, as Tosa clan's public opinion and made Satsudo Meiyaku (the alliance between Satsuma and Tosa) in order to realize Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor).

sen.j: 同年、後藤とともに将軍徳川慶喜に大政奉還を勧告し、武力討幕派の薩摩藩や長州藩に対抗した。
sen.e: In the same year, together with Goto, he persuaded Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA to return power to the Emperor to counter the Satsuma and Choshu clans which insisted to overthrow the bakufu with the use of military power.

In the same year, together with Goto, he persuaded the shogun, Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, to return power to the Emperor to counter the Satsuma and Choshu Domains which insisted to overthrow the bakufu with the use of military power.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れに対応しました。単語の訳を修正しました
sen.e: In the same year, together with Goto, he persuaded the shogun, Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, to return power to the Emperor to counter the Satsuma and Choshu Domains which insisted to overthrow the bakufu with the use of military power.

sen.j: 明治維新では、後藤や板垣らと共に徴士参与として新政府に出仕。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, Fukuoka, together with Goto and Itagaki among the others, served as Choshisanyo (senior councilor) for the new government.
After the Meiji Restoration, Fukuoka, together with Goto and Itagaki among the others, served as Choshisanyo (senior councilor) for the new government.

sen.j: 越前藩の由利公正と「五箇条の御誓文」の草案作成に関与。
sen.e: He was involved in making draft for "Charter Oath of Five" with Kimimasa YURI of the Echizen clan.
He was involved in making a for 'Charter Oath of Five' with Kimimasa YURI of the Echizen Domain.

sen.j: 1871年、王政復古の功を賞されて賞典禄400石を授けられる。
sen.e: In 1871, he was awarded the shotenroku (premium) of 400 koku in recognition of his contribution to the restoration of imperial rule.
In 1871, he was awarded the Shotenroku (premium) of 400 koku in recognition of his contribution to the restoration of Imperial rule.

sen.j: 議事政体取調所御用係を経て1871年には藩の少参事、権大参事。
sen.e: In 1871 he became Shosanji (junior councilor) and Gondaisanji (second to governor) of the clan after serving as Goyogakari (person in charge of the command from the Imperial Household Ministry) at Gijiteisaitorishirabesho (the office to examine parliamentary system).

sen.j: 政府内では土佐閥の一人として、司法大輔や元老院議官、文部卿、参議、枢密顧問官、宮中顧問官などの要職を歴任する。
sen.e: He successively assumed the important central governmental posts as one of the Tosa clique, such as Shiho taifu (senior vice minister of Justice), Ganroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Elders), Monbukyo (chief of Minister of Education), Sangi (councilor), privy councilor and court councilor.

As one of the Tosa clique, he successively assumed the important central governmental posts such as Shiho-taifu (post of Ministry of Justice), Ganroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Elders), Monbukyo (chief of Minister of Education), Sangi (councilor), privy councilor, court councilor, and so on.

sen.j: 司法大輔時代の1872年11月23日、司法卿の江藤新平と共同で、法律で妾を持つことを禁止すべきとの建白書を提出する。
sen.e: On November 23, 1872 when Fukuoka was Shiho taifu, he submitted a petition to forbid the keeping of concubines by law together with Shinpei ETO who was Shihokyo (Justice Minister)

sen.j: しかし、蓄妾は旧来の慣習であったため、建白はいつしか立ち消えとなって採用されることはなかった。
sen.e: However, as keeping concubines was a long-lasting practice, their petition was simply ignored and never adopted.
